title: Five charts that changed the world - BBC Ideas

last_post.content:
A couple of weeks ago I boosted the BBC video about "five charts that changed the world".

I hadn't watched it, I just trusted the BBC and figured it would be good content anyway.

I regretted it. Here is why.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/ideas/videos/five-charts-that-changed-the-world/p0fb69c1

Who else is feeling just buried under #AIhype after the past few weeks? GPT-4’s “system card”? “Sparks of AGI”? OMG skynet is coming “AI pause” letter? If you’re ready for some cathartic BS shoveling, come join me and @alex as we dig out from under all of this on the next episode of Mystery AI Hype Theater 3000.

Friday April 7 (TOMORROW!)
9:30-10:30am Pacific Time
http://twitch.tv/dair_institute

#MAIHT3k #MathyMath #SALAMI

This feels unreal! After more than 6 years working on WebGPU, it's getting released in Chromium 113, in stable and without flags! It only took a bit longer than the 2 year adventure we initially thought it would be 😅 Read more about it here https://developer.chrome.com/blog/webgpu-release/

We ended up having more than 3000 issues on the WebGPI and WGSL specifications (~400 pages total), as many implementation issues, hundreds (thousands?) of hours standardization meetings with dozens of participants.

There are already some crazy things out there, like a version of Stable Diffusion that runs in your web browser. https://github.com/mlc-ai/web-stable-diffusion. I wrote something two years ago about why I think WebGPU makes javascript the most interesting programming language out there for data analysts/ML people. https://benschmidt.org/post/2020-01-15-webGPU/ And there's lots of stuff that's become more conceivable since--for instance, a dataframe based on Apache Arrow that does massively parallel data transformations. Chat-GPT in browser.

A short and sweet review about the interesting properties of large language models.

Samuel R. Bowman, "Eight Things to Know about Large Language Models"

https://cims.nyu.edu/~sbowman/eightthings.pdf

It’s currently the top story on their homepage, and they did a beautiful job with it. I hope you like it. https://www.theverge.com/23650428/colorblindness-design-ui-accessibility-wordle

Do you know there's a #fediverse alternative to Amazon-owned #Goodreads? #BookWyrm is a social network for tracking your reading, writing reviews, and discovering what to read next. You can follow and interact with users on different #BookWyrm instances and on #Mastodon. You can import from a Goodreads CSV export. You can create private shelves and curated lists. Join us at https://ramblingreaders.org or choose one of the other instances available #books #reading  #bookstodon @bookstodon

@J12t @evan @jamiexml

I advocate 2 locations as place-to-be for helping #ActivityPub and #Fediverse move forward.

Yes, the #W3C #SWICG for the AS/AP open standards tracks and mailing list discussion. But also the #SocialHub where #FEP's are discussed and a huge archive of dev discussion is collected.

For years they went hand in hand re:collab, then the SWICG turned inactive while the forum did not. Now looks like there's some split happening.

https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/t/ideating-organization-structure-for-the-grassroots-fediverse-wiki/3037

https://codeberg.org/fediverse/fep

title: After an L.A. Times story on Thomas' gifts, he stopped disclosing

last_post.content: Significant detail regarding #ClarenceThomas failure to disclose multiple gifts of travel from Harlan Crow over the years. In 2004, the LA Times reported on gifts Thomas disclosed he had received from Crow. After this reporting, Thomas didn’t stop accepting gifts from Crow; he just stopped disclosing them. https://www.latimes.com/politics/story/2023-04-06/the-times-reported-about-justice-thomas-gifts-20-years-ago-after-he-just-stopped-disclosing-them #JudicialEthics

title: Why ChatGPT and Bing Chat are so good at making things up

Great piece in @arstechnica (bot account) from @benjedwards, where he seeks to reframe the "hallucinations" generated by #genAI #generativeAI models like #ChatGPT instead as "confabulations", drawing from human psychology.

The language we use, and the terms we ascribe to the behaviour of #LLMs is really important - because it frames the debates around them, it shapes epistemology and how we inquire about them, and moreover, it influences the direction that #research takes.

It’s sadly not gone well and Monty yelled at the current CEO on stage at the last all hands.

title: Opinion | Online Ads Are Serving Us Lousy, Overpriced Goods

last_post.content:
So it turns out that there's science to back up my impression that twitter adds are mostly from from small companies trying to sell overpriced, low-quality goods.

Below, a quote from Julia Angwin's Op Ed (which is very good and well worth reading—and unpaywalled here https://www.nytimes.com/2023/04/06/opinion/online-advertising-privacy-data-surveillance-consumer-quality.html?unlocked_article_code=OIFrCYZY-Z_NrkGZjH7-w_qapSe6zAhYXqj5uKOjPw3FBNm9NX4D1elRRzO51YGAekpza5uvXmr5qSAZQ9pBhshxwqyg0mfcEcwkrywhfvFCMHeMFxV7ZRlWbqDPg5QeU-iluF4jtrGJ8l-kHoR5Nd8Vx4u55gEz-8jcwGUMi8XTW0fAFyYcB_NNHcNw7NGSx8I6bizzoVOQ1fCcHHten9j56woNsW8zvZtgDcsTj-9JRRJStOTqf6Tx81wPYxjrrJ8yVPzWrdARTnht1F67-nbReOTka1pk3-Kgbz2r7m3I97U6MvSrqeQEGGwBEyAy2RVi96cXPpxS4Kn2-g3XsgkSEoqb54KYHuHOd6xjFsMQg_wQo17ymRUhXBTEmpcm6r5rSUQn2A&smid=url-share )

The research paper itself: https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4398428

So it turns out that there's science to back up my impression that twitter adds are mostly from from small companies trying to sell overpriced, low-quality goods.

Below, a quote from Julia Angwin's Op Ed (which is very good and well worth reading—and unpaywalled here https://www.nytimes.com/2023/04/06/opinion/online-advertising-privacy-data-surveillance-consumer-quality.html?unlocked_article_code=OIFrCYZY-Z_NrkGZjH7-w_qapSe6zAhYXqj5uKOjPw3FBNm9NX4D1elRRzO51YGAekpza5uvXmr5qSAZQ9pBhshxwqyg0mfcEcwkrywhfvFCMHeMFxV7ZRlWbqDPg5QeU-iluF4jtrGJ8l-kHoR5Nd8Vx4u55gEz-8jcwGUMi8XTW0fAFyYcB_NNHcNw7NGSx8I6bizzoVOQ1fCcHHten9j56woNsW8zvZtgDcsTj-9JRRJStOTqf6Tx81wPYxjrrJ8yVPzWrdARTnht1F67-nbReOTka1pk3-Kgbz2r7m3I97U6MvSrqeQEGGwBEyAy2RVi96cXPpxS4Kn2-g3XsgkSEoqb54KYHuHOd6xjFsMQg_wQo17ymRUhXBTEmpcm6r5rSUQn2A&smid=url-share )

title: Petition: Commit to not amending the Equality Act's definition of sex

last_post.content:
If you have a UK address, please sign this, even if it is not the sort of engagement you would normally do with politics. https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/627984

The current noises coming from the Equalities and Human Rights Commission and the Equalities minister mean many trans folks are now seriously considering the need to flee the UK. Usually, this would just be a case of business as usual for the current incarnation of the Tory party, but Labour is apparently happy to go along with it.

title: ‘Alien Calculus’ Could Save Particle Physics From Infinities | Quanta Magazine

last_post.content: "The secret to fixing a fatal flaw at the heart of quantum theory may lie in three obscure textbooks from the 1980s." Read @charliewood's epic @QuantaMagazine feature about an epic, if obscure, body of work known as "resurgence" that itself is resurging. https://www.quantamagazine.org/alien-calculus-could-save-particle-physics-from-infinities-20230406/

title: The Talk Show ✪: Ep. 371, With Daniel Jalkut

last_post.content: Fascinating discussion on the latest The Talk Show with @gruber@mastodon.social and @danielpunkass about AI. What does it mean for humanity when more tasks can be automated and fewer people need traditional jobs? As a developer, a lot of my time isn’t coding but thinking how something should work.

Fascinating discussion on the latest The Talk Show with @gruber@mastodon.social and @danielpunkass about AI. What does it mean for humanity when more tasks can be automated and fewer people need traditional jobs? As a developer, a lot of my time isn’t coding but thinking how something should work.

This is exactly how I've been feeling for the last few months. It is becoming almost impossible to keep up with the current pace of research.

#phdlife #machinelearning
---
RT @natolambert
Almost everyone I know working in AI these days feels one step away from total burnout. I took the time to take you behind the curtain and know what people on the state-of-the-art AI are struggling with:

https://robotic.substack.com/p/behind-the-cu…
https://twitter.com/natolambert/status/1643751135856164864

title: Click here to support Support Community Radio! in the KWMR Spring Pledge Drive 2023

last_post.content: I’m on the board of #KWMR #WestMarin community radio in #PointReyes . We’re running a fundraising campaign, and we’re $5k from our goal. If you love community radio, this region, or you are just feeling generous, I’d love it if you could make a donation to our station. https://kwmr.kindful.com/support-kwmr-spring-2023/support-crowdfunding-board

title: LTI Colloquium: Green AI- Efficiency in NLP

last_post.content: First was a stellar talk by Jesse Dodge on efficiency in #NLP at the #CMU Language Technologies Institute. From algorithmic efficiency to computing model carbon output to problems with text scraping datasets, there's a ton in this talk. Highly recommend https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZFqm7NnRAe0 (2/10) #sustainability #AI

There are undoubtedly other grassroots organizations in #Tennessee to support right now, but one I know of & admire is #RadioFreeNashville. Their slogan when they launched was "unbuckling the Bible Belt."

There are always pockets of people with good politics even in the reddest of states. If you feel like supporting their mission, feel free to donate and/or boost:

https://radiofreenashville.org/

#radio #CommunityRadio #LPFM #CommunityMedia

title: 2023 David E. Nelson Memorial Lecture & Spring Tech Careers Fair

last_post.content:
Join us for the 2023 David E. Nelson Memorial Lecture with @nicholson : Governance and Liability Issues in Medical AI

2023 David E. Nelson Memorial Lecture
Thursday, April 13, 2023 | 5:30 PM PT
California Memorial Stadium, University Club
2227 Piedmont Ave, Berkeley, CA
In-person (not hybrid)

The Nelson Lecture will be followed by a fireside chat with Professor Price and Berkeley Center for Law & Technology (BCLT)’s Life Sciences Project Director, Allison Schmitt. During the fireside chat, they will explore these governance and liability issues in more depth.

Register to secure your seat at the lecture: https://www.law.berkeley.edu/research/bclt/bcltevents/2023-david-e-nelson-memorial-lecture-career-fair/

#AI #LifeScience #UCBerkeley

title: YouTuber known for pranks shot in the abdomen while filming at a mall, suspect arrested

last_post.content:
I don’t be like that old guy who starts bashing every trend or new thing, but I feel like shooting YouTubers could eventually have some negative consequences maybe we can’t foresee now.

https://www.cbsnews.com/news/youtuber-tanner-cook-shot-at-mall-classified-goons-filming-prank-suspect-alan-colie-arrested/
Great talk on the LOST WOMEN of INTERACTION DESIGN now online https://youtu.be/EBq5y5GuTxA by the amazon @emalone

54 years ago today, the brilliant & delightful Steve Crocker, then at UCLA, circulated to the nascent Network Working Group a "Request for Comment" about Host Software. This was #RFC 1, the first of what are now 9411 technical documents defining (and ever evolving) the Internet as we know it.

To me, the Internet is the RFC series, even more than the computers that implement them.

So: Happy 54th birthday, Internet!

https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc1

Today #Twitter "started blocking links to Substack. We hope this action was made in error and is only temporary." https://open.substack.com/pub/on/p/directrelationships?r=1g77q&utm_campaign=post&utm_medium=email

title: Housing Vacancies and Homeownership - Historical Tables

last_post.content:
Does anyone run a competition where participants race to convert data with ghastly formatting into usable structures? #DataScience

My entry for this week, from the US Census: https://www.census.gov/housing/hvs/data/histtabs.html

#SebastienBubeck is arguing that there is a quality jump in #GPT4. His hypothesis is that this system is able to learn some kind of #algorithm. Well even if this is true, we will not know what algorithms have been learned and which mathematical properties they have. So how may this advance our understanding of how learning works? I don’t see it.

https://youtube.com/watch?v=qbIk7-JPB2c&feature=share

title: Interview #7 with Mar Hicks on »The politics of Artificial Intelligence and Algorithmic Bias«

last_post.content:
🔥 Interview with Mar Hicks:

The politics of Artificial Intelligence and Algorithmic Bias.
https://trainingthearchive.ludwigforum.de/en/interview-7-en/

This video interview with Mar Hicks for #TrainingTheArchive puts current technological developments in #AI in perspective with the #history of computing. It discusses the gendered power structures behind computing.

Mar Hicks is an author, historian, and professor doing research on the history of computing, labor, technology, and queer science and technology studies.

In which I am consulted for my expertise on not keeping your mouth shut.

https://www.usnews.com/news/the-report/articles/2023-04-07/court-case-presents-trump-with-a-new-challenge-keeping-quiet

title: Twitter appears to be going to war with Substack

last_post.content:
RT @joinmastodon@twitter.com

Not a good sign if you need to build a wall to keep people in. Twitter did it to last year, and they're doing it to #Substack now. They can get away with anything as long as they keep you locked in. The future of social media is open and decentralized.
